page.text: Thalia Patrinos
20 Henry Street Apt # 1AS  Brooklyn, NY 11201
301.412.3909  patrinos.thalia@gmail.com
Education

text.b: The Johns Hopkins University, Baltimore, MD

page.text: Bachelor of Arts: English and Global Environmental Change and Sustainability, May 2014
Cumulative GPA: 3.34
Volunteer Experience

text.b: President, The Johns Hopkins University Students for Environmental Action,

page.text: • Organized and led a group devoted to environmental sustainability issues on/off campus.
• Built members’ leadership skills and facilitated group bonding through campaigns, trips, and projects.

text.b: Volunteer, The Students’ Health and Welfare Centers Organization,

page.text: • Developed lesson plans and taught English and Life Lessons to Grade 9 girls in Cape Town, South Africa.

text.b: Media Coordinator, Maryland Student Climate Coalition,

page.text: • Facilitated student awareness, recruitment, and support for the “Wind Works for Maryland” campaign.
• Developed contextual informational templates and documents with programs such as Microsoft Office Suite,
Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Premiere, and Adobe InDesign.
• Organized media outreach activities such as phonebanking, petitioning, tabling, lobbying, and rallies.
• Presented public speeches in support of the Maryland Offshore Wind Energy Act, which passed in 2013.

text.b: Director and Trainer, Sierra Student Coalition Summer Program,

page.text: • Organized a trainings team, facilitated conference calls through Google Docs/Hangout, delegated tasks and
roles, and handled all transportation, food, and housing logistics for the Southwest program of 2012.
• Recruited, designed training templates, and led environmental activism trainings in the Rustbelt program of
2011. Trainings included: Grassroots Outreach, Communicating with the Media, Recruitment 101, Building a
Leadership Team, Anti-Oppression, and Event-planning.
Professional Experience

text.b: Communications and Development Intern, Urban Green Council,

page.text: • Created content and visual media for the Urban Green Council website and social media sites.
• Supported fundraising and membership correspondence.
• Assisted with event planning and execution.
• Researched and wrote articles about civic consumption connected to energy, the environment, sustainable
living, time management, health, body, family, social justice, income inequality, climate change, or technology.
• Served as an ambassador to Groundswell’s brand.
• Sat in on weekly editorial brainstorming sessions, and had a firsthand role in developing the content schedule.
• Developed programs to generate community awareness of the Aquarium’s educational and cultural programs.
• Assisted with the design of collateral for community meetings, conferences, and internal and external events.
• Provided correspondence with the local community about community programs and events.

text.b: Power Shift Intern, Chesapeake Climate Action Network,

page.text: • Oversaw fundraising, transportation, and outreach for the National Power Shift conference.
• Wrote and published blog posts and articles, in addition to using social media, to advertise for Power Shift.
• Organized community outreach activities such as petitioning, door-to-door canvassing, and tabling at events.

text.b: Eco-representative, The Johns Hopkins University Office of Sustainability,

page.text: • Developed activities and projects designed to promote sustainability and wellness on campus.
• Worked with a team to plan and coordinate outreach and awareness events, such as movie screenings.
• Served as a liaison to Hopkins student organizations and shared regular updates with the team about
organizations’ work and their involvement.
